item.title: Baked Sea Bass with Peppers
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Serves 2, oven at 200°C, takes around 50 minutes overall. Goes well with green beans. From Judith’s green recipe book. 2 halves sea bass1 red pepper, cut into chunks1 yellow pepper, ditto1 small red onion, cut into wedges2 tomatoes, quartered25g pine nuts15g parsley, choppedOlive oilSalt Put peppers, tomatoes, onion, and salt in a small roasting […]

item.title: Mackerel Salad
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Serves 2 fairly generously. Best if potatoes cooked well in advance. 240g smoked mackerel200g new potatoes, quartered and steamed or boiledSalad leaves Juice of 1 lemon1 tbsp olive oil1 tsp wholegrain mustard1 tsp maple syrup, optionalSalt Prepare dressing: mix lemon juice olive oil, mustard, salt, and maple syrup if using. Shake vigorously to emulsify. Scatter […]

item.title: Frozen Pea Soup
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Serves 2 250g frozen peas250ml Marigold vegetable stockOptional 10 mint leaves from the garden½ tbsp basil olive oil Cook peas in the stock. Add mint leaves if available. Liquidise. Add oil, stir in, serve.

item.title: Moussaka
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark

item.title: Toucan Surprise
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Toucan Surprise (Serves 4, oven at 200°C) 1 can tuna (or more, suggests Judith) 1 can condensed mushroom soup Sweetcorn — tinned or frozen (if frozen, cook along with pasta) 400g pasta Grated cheese for topping Put pasta on to boil, and heat oven. Take a mixing bowl large enough to hold everything, and mix […]

item.title: Vegetable Lasagne
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.category: Does not kill in five minutes
item.description: Serves 4–6, oven at 180°C. Ragu 2×400g tins chopped tomatoes2 onions, chopped1 carrot, chopped1 stick celery, chopped1 tsp sugar10 tbsp olive oil2 tsp dried oregano1–2 garlic cloves, crushed1 green and 1 red pepper, de-seeded and chopped225g courgettes, thinly sliced225g mushrooms, sliced White Sauce 750ml milk50g margarine50g flourground nutmeg Lasagne 250g lasagneparmesan cheese This needs big […]

item.title: Flapjack
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: This is a dairy-free recipe, based on one from the “Kerry Pure” website.http://www.puredairyfree.co.uk/Recipes/45/Flapjack Makes 16 175g Vitalite 125g demerara sugar 2 tbsp golden syrup (heat the spoon) 350g porridge oats Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a 25cm square baking tin. Put Vitalite, syrup and sugar into a large saucepan over a medium heat and stir […]

item.title: 15-Minute Stir Fry
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: This recipe is delicious, quick and incredibly flexible, and will cause complete chaos in your kitchen. The original recipe is on page 298 of Good Housekeeping’s New (sic) Step-By-Step Cookbook. Ingredients Oil, 1 tbsp p.p. Cashews, a handful. Feel free to use extra since you will be snacking on them during the later stages of cooking. […]

item.title: Beans on Toast
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: Not really beans on toast at all, but that’s the name that brings it to mind. It’s a chickpea and tomato stew really. Ian! Next time, try adding a frozen spinach block to the bean mix. Generous quantities for 4 2 onions, garlic, finely chopped2 potatoes, boiled and cubed2 tsp cumin (optionally the same of […]

item.title: Oil and Vinegar Chocolate Cake
item.dc:creator: Ian Stark
item.description: (serves ??, oven at 180°C) 200g plain flour220g granulated sugar30g cocoa powder1 tsp bicarbonate of soda½ tsp salt1 tbsp white vinegar100ml vegetable oil2 tsp instant coffee250ml water 20cm square tin Mix dry ingredients in a bowl, add remaining ingredients then stir. Pour into tin and bake in a pre-heated oven at 180°C for 30 minutes […]
